{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=1949 |Team=Notre Dame Fighting Irish |Image=NotreDameFightingIrish.svg |ImageSize=150 px |Conference=Independent |Division= |ShortConference=Independent |CoachRank= |APRank= |Record=10-0 |ConfRecord= |HeadCoach=[[Frank Leahy]] |OffCoach= |DefCoach= |Captain=[[Leon Hart]] |Captain2=Jim Martin |OScheme=[[T formation|T-Formation]] |DScheme= |StadiumArena=[[Notre Dame Stadium]] |Champion=National Champions }} The '''1949 Notre Dame Fighting Irish football team''' represented the [[University of Notre Dame]] during the [[1949 college football season]]. The Irish, coached by [[Frank Leahy]], ended the season with 10 wins and no losses, winning the [[NCAA Division I-A national football championship|national championship]].{{cite web |url=http://und.cstv.com/auto_pdf/p_hotos/s_chools/nd/sports/m-footbl/auto_pdf/07fbguidehistory |title = 2007 Notre Dame Media Guide: History and Records (pages 131-175) | publisher= und.cstv.com | accessdate=2008-12-31}} The 1949 team became the seventh Irish team to win the national title and the third in four years. Led by Heisman winner [[Leon Hart]], the Irish outscored their opponents 360-86. The 1949 team is the last team in what is considered to be the Notre Dame Football dynasty, a stretch of games in which Notre Dame went 36-0-2 and won three national championships and two [[Heisman Trophy|Heisman Trophies]]. The Irish squad was cited by [[Sports Illustrated]] as the part of the second best [[Dynasty (sports)|sports dynasty]] (professional or collegiate) of the 20th century{{cite news |url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/centurys_best/news/1999/05/06/top_dynasties/|title = SI's Top 20 Dynasties of the 20th Century| publisher=''sportsillustrated.cnn.com''| accessdate=2008-12-31 | date=1999-06-03}} and second greatest college football dynasty.{{cite news |url= http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/multimedia/photo_gallery/2005/12/25/gallery.dynasty/content.11.html |title = College Footballâs 12 Greatest Dynasties | publisher=''sportsillustrated.cnn.com''| accessdate=2008-12-31}} ==Season== ===Depth chart===
